1.content:
This Fantasy Adventure Interactive will have five various races that I have chosen carefully to fill which ever desired race you wish to be. The First choice is that of the Human race which will be generally the most adaptable of the four remaining races. They will have no particular talent in that unless specified in such. Such as Warriors having greater physical strength and knowledge in weaponry, if you choose them to have a specific weapon.

The Second race I chose for this interactive are Giants. The Giants are usually about One hundred feet tall and excel in physical activity. Although the Giants have little capacity to learn magic they still are able to learn it. Unfortunately there are other races that I have chosen that are much better at learning magic than them.

The Third race for this race is one that excels in Magic, but lacks physical strength mostly due to there lack of size. They are known as Fairies whom are smaller than humans and are no bigger then four inches tall. Due to there small stature stealing is easy for them, they're one of race to have the most effective magic.

The Fourth race for the Interactive are the Orcs. According to most races Orcs are seen as savage and stupid creatures who don't know the difference of right and wrong and willing to do anything just to get an extra kill. Although that is what is believed it is not actually true as Some Orcs can be as cunning as most humans or fairies. They're occasional impaired speech is usually due to them not understanding the human language very well. They do however have greater physical strength when compared to a human. An Orc's capacity to learn magic however is somewhat less than that of a humans. Which leads us finally to the final choice.

The fifth and final choice I have chosen for this interactive are Mermaids. A Mermaid is a bit more unique when compared to other races as there abilities tend to reflect there nature and personality. One of their unique abilities is one that none of the mermaids under the water were even aware of which is the ability to have legs when they are completely dried up. Although they do gain legs when completely dried up. However they wouldn't know how to walk or stand with them as they never had them before. Unless of course they are a mermaid who discovered this ability early on. When a mermaid is in water they are one of the strongest and toughest to beat. A mermaid will also have greater magic abilities in water, however the further away from water and on land they are the weaker there magic and physical strength.

I hope you understand the differences between the five races that I have chosen. Now before you set off on your Fantasy Adventure Interactive which race will you be?

you were traveling by horse. Your father was off making armor which left you to see the royal family by yourself. As you approach the castle you see that it is a marvelous structure with many arches and a pristine garden. You notice a fair maiden who is no older than you playing on her harp with her sword by her side. She has golden hair and lovely brown eyes. Her voice sounds like an angel descending from heaven. She stops singing and playing her harp once you dismount from your horse.

"Who are you kind sir." the maiden says as she grabs her sword.

You introduce yourself to the maiden and do a slight bow.

You follow Loraine to the...

"Yes, your majesty he has arrived and is behind me as we speak." Princess Loraine told her father. You then bowed towards the king and gave him a greeting. "Greetings your Highness it is a pleasure to meet you, I am sorry my father couldn't make it but he had other pressing business to attend to." You said.

"That is quite alright, you may stand now, I didn't just call you here to dine after all." The King said.

You got up from your position and for the first time were able to get a good look at that King. You noticed that unlike his daughter the King had brown hair with a mustache, blue eye's and a particularly strong physique. From this you can tell that the King had many battles that he had fought in the past. Perhaps he even fought alongside your father with them, of course you wouldn't know anything unless you asked him. As for the queen sitting by his side you recognized the golden hair immediately and her pale complexion suggested that she didn't leave the castle often. Her pale complexion began to worry you though, something was off it was as though she was too pale.

"Your majesty is there something wrong with The Queen she looks quite pale?" You asked. The King then answered...

"It's the real reason I called you here. Two weeks ago the queen and I were out for a ride in the forest. It was after we took a break that the Witch of Weslone. She uttered a curse and cast it on the queen before vanishing. My wife was fine until we got back from our ride. It was then that she collapsed. I had every magician and scientist in the kingdom try to create a cure but she only got worse. She's so sick that she can't even speak." The king said as he sighed.

"Where can I find the cure?" You ask.

"They say that the cure is in Weslone. The wicked witch Marlani enjoys seducing men with her charms. My daughter is skilled in swordplay and magic. She should be able to find the cure with you."

You and Lorraine leave the throne room.

Thinking of the actions of the witch of Weslone. Something has been on your mind for quite a while and it's been bugging you this entire time. Loraine notices your pondering and then begins to ask. " Lion Warrior? Is there something that's bothering you?" Loraine asks.

" Yes, your father never mentioned what the witch wanted in return for the cure. It seems rather strange for people to poison a queen just for the sake of poisoning." You said.

I agree, It is strange but not unusual, perhaps will found out more when we reach Weslone." Loraine said. You and Loraine continued the track towards Weslone wasn't a walk in the park but it would be a week before you even managed to get near it, provided that they would let you in.

As the sun set you and Loraine decided it would be best to end today's travels at the local inn. It was there that you saw your father waiting almost as if he was expecting you. " Good to see you son. Hope you had a good feast." He said.

"It was extravagant, however at the King's request I am travelling towards Weslone. With some aid of course." You said. Your father then took a glance at Loraine and gave a slight disapproving look. "Traveling with women will just bring you trouble."

From you father's comment and the look on Loraine's face you could tell that she felt...

"You seriously think I'm the type of woman that would seduce your son?! Or do you think I'm incapable of defending myself? Not only am I the princess, but I'm also the commander of my father's army." Loraine said as she pulled out her sword.

Loraine sheaths her sword."I'm glad that you understand why my father chose me to come along with your son. If he went alone the witch of Weslone would turn him into her personal servant with her seductive wiles."

You, Loraine and your father head towards Weslone. Meanwhile the witch watched from her crystal ball and gave an evil smirk.

You, your father, and Loraine have been travelling for four days. Loraine has proved herself quite capable when it comes to a fight and you start feeling attracted to her and vice versa. You and your father were collecting firewood while Loraine cooked dinner. As you head back to camp the sun was setting. You and your father were having a conversation.

"Hey (Name), It seems like you and the princess have gotten pretty close." your father said in a teasing manner.

"Is it that obvious? Sure she's pretty, but any woman that can fight is dropdead gorgeous!"

"It was only a matter of time. Huh? Keep a sharp eye son. We have company."

"Indeed, I can see the bushes rustle. Come out and fight like a man!"

Out of the bushes came what appeared to be an anthropomorphic lion. He stood nine feet tall and had black fur covering his body. His red trousers were the only article of clothing that he wore. His eyes were a shade of menacing red. Before you can strike him, he moves behind you and bites down hard on your arm. You drop your sword as you quickly bandage the wound. Your father tries to help you, but only to find himself in the same predicament. The lion man leaves as quickly as he appeared. You yell in frustration, swearing to kill the lion man the next time you see him. The rest of the night goes smoothly.
111112111.title: Curse of the Werelion

You share your frustration that the lion man eluded you, but together you both vow that if you meet him again you will take his head.

The next day the three of you continue onwards and have a pleasantly uneventful day. The three of you talk on the road, and you feel yourself drawing closer to Loraine, her mind revealing itself to be as sharp as her blade and as beautiful as her visage.

That night you settle on watch, and agree to notify each other the second there is any sign of trouble. The three of you sleep with your swords at the ready.

You take the first watch and carefully patrol the camp, reacting to the slightest movement or sound. As the night draws on, you began to relax, feeling this night may pass without incident.

Suddenly you see something in the back of your eye. Its the lion man, and hes running at you! How did he sneak up behind you? You thoguht you had watched every possible entrance to your camp!

You reach for sword, though it feels off in your hand, as though the grip is suddenly too small and prepare to do battle.

But something is strange about this lion man, he doesn't look the same as before....

But something is strange about this lion man, he doesn't look the same as before. His hair is different. His fur is black like your father's hair. That's when it hits you. You then realize why your sword feels too small. That lion man must of been a lycantrope. You then realize that your arms are covered in red fur. Your father must think your the lion man from the other night.

"Stop!"

Your father halts in confusion.

"You think you can fool me? I'll make you pay for what you did to me and my son!"

Unfortunately, your father is oblivious to the his obvious changes. You don't want to harm him or have him kill you by mistake. There must be something you can do to bring him to his senses. You decide to lure your father away from the grounds and towards the lake. As you clash swords you can see clouds forming overhead. Your new feline senses tell you it's about to rain. Within a matter of minutes you both arrive at the lake. You then outmaneuver your father and pin him to the ground, looking directly into the lake.

"Why are there two lion men?" Your father asked as you lifted yourself off of him.

"I was trying to tell you. Mom was right. You are stubborn. Father? What happened to us?"

"I don't know, but if this is part of that witch's plan we better head back to camp and make sure the princess is safe."

"Your right."

You and your father rush back to camp. Fortunately Loraine was still asleep. Hopefully she won't panic if she sees you like this.

You gently nudge her. As she awakens you can tell that she's not in a good mood. When she fully wakes up...

111112111212.content:
At the sight of the two lion men standing over her, Loraine let an almost melodic yet piercing scream. You both cover your ears, and your quite surprised, when she rolls smooth and deftly, grabbing her sword and sprining to her feet, landing in a combat stance, her eyes reflecting a similar battle readiness.

"Do not let your guard down, lad!" Your father yells, raising his own sword, but assuming a more defensive stance. "She means to kill us!"

"Dam right I do!"

She swings her sword at you in a graceful but you block it almost by instinct. Could this body be more agile than your human flesh.

"Loraine wait! It's me, the Lion Warrior!"

"You're with the lion who attacked us last night!"

She swings again, but you step back. Father moves to flank her if needed, but does not attack.

"We are the two warriors who were travelling you!" Father says. "We were bitten by that lion and now we are werelions to!"

She steps away, but still keeps her sword raised.

"You lie!" Despite saying this, she hesitates, looking the two of you over for any trace of truth or lie.

"It's true." You say. "We're questing to cure your sick father."

"Why do you think we haven't attacked you?"

Loraine's sword arm wavers, but she does not shift out of her stance.

"I- I don't know, but for all I know you could be trying to trick me into lowering my guard so you can infect."

You take a risk, and lower your sword, while staring deep into her eyes.

"Loraine, I'm not lying. Look into my eyes and you'll see."

Loraine craned her head up, staring deep into your eyes.

"Lion Warrior? That's you? I'm so sorry and it's my mother who is sick."

"Now that is settled we need a way to cure ourselves. It would be terrible if we were stuck like this and we got killed by people that we;'re trying to protect." Your father says.

"I wish there was a simple way to cure you two, but the only known way is to kill the werelion who bit you. If you fail to do so within two weeks you'll be lycantopes forever."

"That is bad. It may not be bad if we can use this to kill that witch."

"You may not have a bad idea son, but this Marlani could prove troublesome if she tries to take control of us and have us attack the princess."

"You have a point father."

You hear thunder in the distance. It then begins to rain. Fortunately the princess built a shelter just in case. Loraine falls back asleep. However she starts sleep talking, You sigh at how utterly adorable she is in her sleep You yourself begin to fall asleep as well. Your father keeps watch as you and Loraine sleep soundly. Meanwhile in Weslone Castle Marlani grinned evilly as she saw the events unfold.

"This is excellent! Now all I have to do is make them do my bidding."

One of Marlani's subordinates enters the room.

"If I may milady, allow me the honor of slowing them down. I have a few tricks at my disposal."

"The last time your tricks caused my whole army to undergo intensive training."

"That may be true, but it was worth it."

"Very well Sakara, but don't go overboard."

"There's no guarantees, but I shall do my best to control my fetish from getting the better of me."

With that Sakara teleports out of the room.

Loraine aplogises profusely for her actions last, but both you and father are understanding.

Being on the road for three days you all begin to miss civiliation, and your relieved to see a village. As you approach a friendly looking lady stops you. She pushes a cart in front of her, so you assume she's a merchant. A pleasent smell wafts from it.

"Good day sirs and ladies." She says, paying special attention to you. "You must be tired from you're long journey, would you like a sample of my wares?"

You all lean a little closer. Something feels strange, but the smell of her ware is so good....
11111211121211.title: Do the werelions turn back in the morning?

"Sure we could use something to eat." You say not noticing female thief who mingled with your party.

"So that will be four samples then?" The merchant said as she concealed her real intent.

"Huh? There's only three of us." You say in a confused manner while the thief stands among your group in plain sight.

"Son, she must be referring to this beggar."

The thief crosses her arms.

"I wouldn't trust that merchant if I were you folks. She reeks of murder." The thief whispers to you.

"Sorry ma'am but how can we trust you. By the looks of it you could of robbed us without us noticing a thing." Loraine addresses the thief.

"I'm not that kind of thief. I work as a locksmith, repo woman, and hired assassin or bodyguard. I only steal if the city wants me to collect on someone's debt."

"Take these samples anyway and here are some extras on the house."

You thankfully accept and walk to the town's park. Once there you and your father begin devouring the food. Loraine carefully inspects the food due to the merchant's suspicious smile that went unnoticed by you and your father and the thief who is still following you refuses to eat hers.

"Is there any reason why that thief still following us and why haven't you eaten anything yet Loraine?" You ask.

"I don't know and I'm trying to make sure our food wasn't magically laced with something. I'll eat later. I'm not extremely hungry at the moment."

"If you insist."

Sakura and/or the witch and/or her minions

You and father eagerly eat. The food is delicious, better than anything you've had in days. You try to reassure Loraine, though she isn't entirely convinced.

Drumming out the protests of the thief while remaining vigilant you continue on your way. However you have only taken a few steps when you are suddenly struck with dizziness and tiredness. Your eyes grow heavy and you have trouble walking, the world seems to spin and fade from view and you suddenly slump down.

"Lion Warrior!" You hear Loraine yell. Even as she runs to you, her voice sounds so distant. Before you fade from consciousness, you hear the stranger yell out.

"I told you not to trust her!"

You are dead to the world now. Were you still conscious you would be relived to know you were merely infected by a powerful sleeping drought. Whoever that lady is, she is likely springing her trap and it will be up to Loraine and perhaps the stranger to protect you.

An unknown amount of time passes, but it feels like hours. You awaken slowly, your head still acheing and your vision blurry. Standing over you is-
1111121112121112.title: It's a trap!

choices: Loraine and Gilda the thief come to your rescue
A subordinate from the witch stops Sakara

Standing over you is the merchant from before. However she smiles wickedly at you.

"So you're the great Lion Warrior. Today is my lucky day. I'm going to break every bone in your bodies and make you bleed until you want to die. This is going to be so delightful!"

You look and notice that she has black wings jutting out of her back. She's a dark fairy and by the looks of the magical knives and hammers she has a fetish for bloodshed.

"Be a good Lion Warrior and let me hurt you!"

You and your father clumsily try dodging the psychotic dark fairy and her magical weapons. Unfortunately she managed to cut your arm. On the flip side your arm starts healing until there is no visible wound.

"Ooo! This should make things more fun!"

"Who are you!" Your father yells at the fairy.

"My name is Sakara and it is time for you to die!"

As you and your father try running for your lives Sakara kills innocent bystanders. You feign in horror as you see her take pleasure in her kills. You haven't met anyone who murders for pure pleasure.

Unfortunately the poison starts taking effect again. You start feeling dizzy.

"Perfect! now I can break you!"

It all seems over until...
11111211121211122.title: Sakara The Dark Fairy with the Bloodlust Fetish

You refuse or make something up

You swing your sword, but you swing is clumsy and slow, the poison throwing you off balance. Sakara effortlessly dodged, and laughs as she slashes your other arm..

She licks her lips at the sight of your flowing blood.

"I'm going to enjoy this!"

You gnash your teeth and try to go on the defensive, but it seems hopeless until a throwing knife hits Sakara in the back. She cries out in pain.

Running towards you, you see Loraine and the strange man from before.

Sakara gnashes her teeth.

"I can't fight the four of you!" She stretches her wings out and takes flight, looking behind her so she can change course as the man throws another knife. "Until next time, Lion Warrior!"

Loraine and stranger run to you. Loraine holds out her arm and tries to steady you.

"Are you alright?"

"I've been poisoned but it doesn't seem fatal."

She checks the wounds one your arms, only to see them healing. Loraine, but especially the stranger looks astonished.

"What sorcery is this?!" He demands.

"It must be a side effect of-" Loraine stops. "I mean I don't know..."

"Thank you." You said. "If you hadn't come that fairy might have killed me.."

"My name is Gilda. How are you healing your wounds that way?"

You have heard lyncathorpes have a supernatural ability to heal their wounds, even in human form. However you have only just met this man, even if he saved your life. Do you really want to let him know your secret?

"That's interesting, but you got one thing wrong. I'm a woman. So you're a lycanthrope. It takes courage to tell a trained assassin that."

"Thank you ma'am and I'm so sorry I thought you were a man. It's just you dress like a guy."

"Don't sweat it. If I dressed like this princess no one would take me seriously."

"What did you mean by that? I'm a lot tougher than I look."

"I don't doubt that princess, so how much are you going to pay me?"

You and your party head to Gilda's house. Thankfully their were enough rooms for the night. You and your father are still drowsy from the poison you consumed earlier, but tomorrow you'll be able to find the antidote.

"Do you know anyone who can help cure our lyncantrhopy?"

"That's going to be alot harder, but I'll see what I can do. You might want to keep hush about that, as you'll find others aren't as tolerant as I am..

Getting an antidote for Sakara's poison turns out to be a simple task, only costing you a small amount of gold. However you spend the rest of the day fruitlessly searching for an antidote to your lycanthrphy, or a healer who could help you.

"I've had dealings with her before. I recognize that bitch, no matter how she chooses to disguise herself. As long as she is your enemy, I will gladly travel with you."

You hesitate for a second, but then if Gilda wanted to rob you, she has had ample chance to do so already, and her help so far has proved invaluable. You hold your hand out to shake her's.

"Welcome aboard."

"What brings you to our "fair" town? Gilda asks.

You decide to explain everything, on the possiblity she could help.

You spot a strange travelling restaurant owned by a humble man.

"So your on a mission to go to Weslone and cure the queen of her illness, but you got turned into a lycantrophe along with your father. Damn, that sounds real serious. I have to wonder what pyschomaniac would do this. This Marlani sounds dreadfully wicked. That dark fairy is probably her subordinate."

"We better get going. If we can find a magician he should tell us how to make the medication once we get to Weslone." Loraine says.

"I'll tag along since you promised me payment." Gilda says to Loraine.

I can offer other advice if you need it like using the queen as a puppet or striking the king with a bout of insanity." A masked figure said in a strangely calm voice.

You are suspicious

After an uneventful night, you set off the next morning. As you near Weslone, a smartly dressed man rides out to meet you. You wonder if you should avoid him, but he does not seem to pose a threat, so you meet.

"Well met, travellers." He says, in a distinguished voice.

You and your companions return the greeting.

"Good sirs and ladies, I am wondering if you can help me. My city is in desperate crisis and I was searching for any good people who might help me. Of course, you will be well compensated, and I in turn will do whatever I can to help you."

"Don't trust him!" Gilda says. "I have a bad feeling about this..."

Loraine turns to her.

"Can we really ignore someone in crisis? Even if we ourselves are in a hurry?"

Father remains silent, clearly unsure about the situation. You may well be the deciding voice
1111121112121112211111.title: The next day a noble man asks for help for his ...

choices: As the lights go out the ghosts appear
You enjoy the feast that was prepared for you

"I'm glad to hear it. Follow me."

You follow the man to his city. Sure enough you see most of the inhabitants cower in fear.

"What is the issue ?" Loraine asked.

"There have been ghosts showing up scaring the people to death. No one has been able to get any sleep since then." The man replied.

"That is serious." Your father replied.

"Hold a moment. Are we just going to believe this so called nobleman when he hasn't given us his name?" Gilda asked in a mocking tone.

"My name is Cyrone. I founded this city not too long ago. Follow me and I will show you to where you'll be staying."

"Hello! You must be Lord Cyrone's guests. Your rooms are down the right hallway. I took the liberty of preparing an irresistible feast. Tee hee!"

Surely as soon as she mentions the feast your nose picks up the scent of food being cooked.

"That maid seems too familiar and not in that psycho dark fairy familiar." Gilda muses. "I still wouldn't trust this Cyrone."

You all try and beat a hasty retreat
111112111212111221111111.content:
You wonder and hope Gilda is just being paranoid, but you do not let you guard down, even as you enjoy the feast.

Suddenly the lights go out, as though ever candle and torch in the castle had been blown out all at once. The four of you try to find each other, though its difficult in the dark.

An intense, unnatural cold fills the air. Glowing white shapes float towards you, there hands held out to grasp for your throats.

"Ghosts!" You yell, suddenly realizing you have no idea how to fight such enemies.

You turn to your companions, hoping at least one has some kind of plan
111112111212111221111111.title: Sorry it's short

choices: You start becoming addicted to the maid's cooking
Two days later a storm rolls in and prevents you from leaving town
1111121112121112211111111.content:
"How do we beat these things?" You ask.

"Ghosts are weak to light. We need to use fire or light magic against them. I'll hold them off."

"I'm not leaving you alone Loraine. Maybe you can light the torches with your fire magic."

"(Name), that's a great idea."

You and Loraine enact the plan. Shortly afterwards the ghost explode into bursts of light.

"Thank heavens you are all safe. Master Cyrone has went into the cellar. Apparently this entire town was built over an ancient temple. My lord should be deactiviting the portal with his most trusted magicians. I am sorry that your meal was cut short." The maid who greeted you earlier says to you and your party.

"No worries fair maiden. I'm pretty sure we'll be able to resume shortly."

"We must help Cyrone with the portal you mentioned."

"Please don't worry about my master. He is a very talented man."

You do as the maid pleads and resume your feast.
1111121112121112211111111.title: At least one has a plan

choices: You try to regain control of your body but fail
Switch to Gilda's POV
11111211121211122111111111.content:
As you ate you were overwhelmed by the food's taste. After two hours of gorging your vision starts to get blurry from exhaustion. Loraine had already retired for the night and Gilda was out examining the town. You then see the shapes of the maid and Cyrone.

"Who knew this would work. Excellent as always Cyrone. Now to make these two hunky warriors my servants." The maid said in a sinister tone as she used magic to change her outfit.

The maid's dress turned into a flowing black dress adorned by many black feathers and a silver tiara with black and red jewels appeared on her head. Her blonde hair turned raven black. Her complexion was brought to full beauty as red lipstick glossed her lips and blue eye shadow appeared. It was Marlani the Witch of Weslone or better known by her other title, the Black Swan. She was known as the Black Swan because she used various means to enslave men into her army.

"N... No!" You yell before collapsing.

"Once they wake up they'll have no choice but to do my bidding. Now what about that princess?"

"Don't worry my lady, the Slumberflower's pollen should put her into an eternal slumber. I suggest we use her blood to free the inner demon within me."

"What an excellent idea Cyrone."

"Don't mention it milady." Cyrone replied as an evil smirk appeared on his face.
11111211121211122111111111.title: Hypnotic Food

choices: Loraine reaches you telepathically in her sleep
You run into Sakara again and she beats the living daylights out of you for fun
111112111212111221111111111.content:
As you come to you realize that your body is moving. You then see that you, your father, and Loraine are in some town. Marlani enters your room and smiles wickedly at you. You try reaching for your sword, but your body would not budge. You then find your body kneeling to that vile witch against your will.

"Trying to fight my hypnotism Lion Warrior? Don't fight it darling. Tonight you, your father, and my other subordinate Leron will massacre this whole city."

You try to speak but words fail to leave your lips. The only thing you can manage is to shed a single tear. Judging by the town you knew you were three towns away from Weslone. Hopefully you and your father can break out of Marlani's mind control and rescue Loraine.

"What's this? A tear? I thought men didn't cry." Marlani said as she put her hand on one of your well developed pecs.

You shed even more tears as she starts licking your chest. If you had control of your body you would not hesitate in chopping her head off. Fortunately for you she didn't decide to strip you down for her own fancy and use you as a man toy.

"Come Lion Warrior, we have work to do."

You unwillingly follow Marlani as she walks down the hallway and into the war room. You try to take control of your body again but you feel like your mind is chained to something in your subconscious. You can tell that this estate once belonged to someone else, but it seemed like Marlani replaced whoever lived here with one of her subordinates.
111112111212111221111111111.title: You try to regain control of your body but fail

choices: Gilda
Your mother, weapons smith extraordinaire
1111121112121112211111111112.content:
"Come minions the next town is two days away from my beloved Weslone. There we will enchant the Lion Warrior and his father into submission. I can't believe it took nearly three weeks. I had Sakara set up this town a few weeks prior. Once we perform the ceremony they will lose any inkling of freewill."

After hearing that you tackle Marlani as soon as you arrive in Dufflolton. You fight her hold on your mind to begin strangling her.

"Undo... Your spell... witch... I...will... kill... you... either... way..." You manage to say as you fight Marlani's mind control spell on you.

Before you could manage to choke her with your bare hands you feel a sharp pain in your back.

"We meet again Lion Warrior. This time I will break every bone in your body and it will be fun!"

The pain causes you to release Marlani. You try to move but a tree falls on top of you leaving you temporarily paralyzed. While this was going on Gilda, an orc, and a fairy were plotting to rescue you.

"We execute the plan like we discussed. I'll take off with Loraine. Torque will grab the Lion Warrior, and Shalla will use her magic to create a diversion."

"Plan is good."

"You can count on me!"

Gilda and her comrades execute their plan. Fortunately Marlani's men were too concerned about her and her almost being gagged to death. As you were regaining feeling in you body you felt yourself being carried.

"Human heavier than anticipated. Lady thief's plan must succeed." An orcish voice said.

Gilda and her allies manage to save you and Loraine, but your father was left behind due to them being undermanned. Sakara who was satisfied with beating you up was now trying to beat up Shalla's clones When you come to you see
1111121112121112211111111112.title: Sakara's Revenge and Unexpected Rescue!

choices: Loraine awakens!
Loraine is still asleep. Time to find Esmerlda, the Witch of the Forest
11111211121211122111111111121.content:
When you come to you see Gilda.

"Where's my father and Loraine?"

"We unable to rescue your father. Loraine is out like a light in the tent. We tried waking her up but have failed. "

"I see. We can't rescue my father until we wake Loraine."

"What do you intend to do mister?" A fairy in a blue and purple dress asked.

"My mother used to tell me stories of how a hero would kiss a beautiful maiden in order to a curse. If those stories that my mother told my twin sister and I hold some truth, then we can resume rescuing my father."

"What does Warrior man plan if damsel no wake?" The orc that rescued you asked.

" Then I guess we'll have to find a friend of mine. Gilda who are these people?"

"They helped rescue you lovebirds. The orc is Torque and the fairy is Shalla. They have a score to settle with the Witch of Weslone. "

"The Black Swan shall pay for her wickedness!" Shalla declared.

You walk over to the tent and see Loraine fast asleep. You kneel down and press your lips against hers and begin kissing. One minute later...
11111211121211122111111111121.title: Gilda and new allies

choices: You spot your sister and mother. They have news for you and vice versa
You spot a fat gold and white dragon preparing for hibernation.
111112111212111221111111111212.content:
One minute later Loraine is still asleep. You look over Loraine with a worried look on your face. You must find Esmerelda. She is the only one who can lift the curse on the woman you love, but finding Esmerelda may be difficult. The last time you saw her was in Marina when you participating in the Golden Sword Tournament. She remember your last match ending in a draw. The woman you met, Alyssa Bronze was formidable for a woman for her short stature. The men of the town were going to declare you the winner, but to their surprised you said that Alyssa was the true winner. After that Esmerelda and her friend stayed behind for they had to fetch an item for their quest. It didn't dawn on you then, but you now know that it must have dealt with the queen's illness. That was the only reason why she kept it a secret.

"We have to find a friend of mine. Her name is Esmerelda the Witch of the Forest."

You notice that Torque and Shalla recognize who you are talking about.

"We know witch of who you speak."

"It was a month or so ago that we saw her at the caverns."

"That's good to know, but that tells me I've met her shortly afterward. We must find out her whereabouts."

"What should we do?" Gilda asked.

You think it over, but before you can think it over...
111112111212111221111111111212.title: Sleeping Curse not lifted

choices: Gildorum takes off to find food to adjust to the drastic weather change
The White Wolf is planning a trap to capture the dragons and your group
1111121112121112211111111112122.content:
You think it over, but before you can think it over thoroughly you spot a fat gold and white dragon preparing for hibernation. However something seemed off. Sure judging by his girth he started bulking up early, but he seemed a bit too fat for this time of year. Dragons normally spend a few months during the fall gaining as much weight as they can to prepare for hibernation. During that time they enter an annual growth spurt. Once spring comes dragons are usually five to ten feet taller and may have some excess flab to work off or sell to practitioners of magic. You then glance at the sleeping Princess Loraine. The effects of the Slumber Flower must be reversed as soon as possible. If this dragon can help then maybe you wouldn't need Esmerelda's help.

"Sir Lionshield! I'm glad I found you!" the dragon roared as he made a heavy landing.

"What seems to be the problem?"

"A warlock who calls himself the White Wolf has just placed a curse on this land!"

"What kind of curse?" Shalla asked.

"A curse that affects the weather. Just look up in the sky."

You and your party, minus Loraine who's out like a light, notice a dark cloud that blotted out the sun. It then starts snowing.

"Winter not for months. Why White Wolf change weather?" Torque inquired.

"I suspect he's trying to force my species to gain so much weight that we give him a life time supply of Dragon Lard."

"That's cruel, but smart for making money. Dragon Lard isn't common during the summer or spring season or even early fall. The only time there's an abundance is during the winter season or late fall." Gilda said.

"Exactly. Disturbing the balance of nature like this will only cause chaos. My mate is trying to keep her fellow dragons from giving in to the weather induced hunger."

"Hey Lionshield, the Witch of the Forest that you, Shalla, and Torque know, wouldn't she be able to reverse a curse like this?"

"She would if she wasn't in Gimunga. She and her comrades made a deal with Prince Goliath. So she'll be teaching giants how to use magic for a week or so."

"In that case can you wake up our friend? She was recently put under a sleeping curse via Slumber Flower Pollen."

"You asked the right dragon. Dragon magic is one of the most powerful forms of magic; it is only rivaled by fairy magic. However, breaking sleeping curses is what dragons do best. You see each race has their own specified magic."

"Darn, I don't even know my own kind's magic. I only know orc magic." Shalla said.

"A water fairy like yourself should be able to learn fairy magic easily. Each form of magic has different incantations. Trust me, we dragons spend lifetimes learning every race's magic."

You then place Loraine before the dragon. The dragon appears to be ready to breath fire, but you notice that instead of flames it's dragon phermones. You remember your younger twin sister telling you that even dragon pheromones are magical and probably every aspect of a dragon considering how the pelts they shed make great armor, which yet again only occurs during spring. Once doused in pheromones you notice Loraine starting to wake up.

"Mm... Rey... Reymond? What happened to your father and who are these people. Also what's up with the snow?"

"The snow is the result of a warlock. Unfortunately that Cyrone character and the maid were you know who and her minion. Yet he said something about his inner demon within him."

"Now that's just cryptic, but first we must return the weather to normal. I may know just the spell, but first we have to deal with the warlock. Thanks Gildorum for breaking that curse that I was under."

"Anything for you princess. Now we just..." Gildorum is cut off as his stomach grumbles.
1111121112121112211111111112122.title: Winter Comes Early this year?

choices: A monster made of snow attacks
An actual yeti under mind control attacks
11111211121211122111111111121221.content:
"I can't think straight with this ravenous hunger. My kind is usually known for our self-control but with this drastic change the hunger pangs are unbearable!"

Gildorum then lifts off into the sky and seeks out food.

"We have to go after him!" You yell to your to your comrades.

You and your allies chase after Gildorum. Given Gildorum's increased heft his flight spped is slow enough for you to follow.

"I know dragons are supposed to sleep when it's cold, but something feels off. Like it's a combination of human magic and dark fairy magic." Shalla said.

"While we're chasing Gildorum, can you two please tell me your names. I believe you didn't have a chance to speak."

"I'm Shalla and this orc is Torque."

"The name's Loraine."

"Guys, look up ahead!" Gilda shouted.

Before you was what appeared to be a giant corral full of food. You then notice other dragons like Gildorum come out of the caves and flock towards the food.

"This isn't good. I'll try to see if I can help Gildorum. Try speaking to the other dragons. We don't want them to be used as some sort of Dragon Lard farm where this White Wolf can keep them fat year round just to line his pockets."

"You can count on us, Reymond." Loraine replied.

You then approach the gorging Gildorum hoping to help the dragon maintain some self-control.

"Gildorum! It's me the Lion Warrior. You have to stop eating. If you don't the White Wolf will have you in his clutches."

Unfortunately Gildorum is completely under the spell. You then notice that Gildorum is rapidly growing and that Loraine and the others had failed, since the dragons just flew over them.

"Try as you might Lion Warrior, but these dragons will be mine to farm for life." A masculine voiced said.

You turn around and see two people. One's a human man who is slightly shorter than yourself and the other was a male dark fairy. The man was dressed in white wolf pelts and the fairy wore a black cloak that had some streaks of red and white.

"So you're the White Wolf."

"You have guessed correctly. My friend and I are two of the Lords of Darkness. I would love to stay, but our abominable snow monster needs a snack to maintain his mana."

"You're not getting away that easily! Arg..."

"Looks like it's nighttime. I'll let you see my werewolf form before I run. Who knew that Marlani would send her werelion henchman to turn you into a lycanthrope like myself." The White Wolf said as he transformed.

"Werewolves and werelions aren't the only lycanthropes around. You humans and to an extension giants are known for being susceptible to such afflictions. Maybe it's because humans themselves were once giants, but due to a curse they shrunk in size and stature altogether. I would love to see how your affliction corrupts you, but we have to leave." The dark fairy said.

The fully transformed White Wolf and the male dark fairy take off. You hear a roar in the distance.
11111211121211122111111111121221.title: Trying to Tame a Dragon's Hunger

choices: The weather returns to normal and the dragons didn't get too big.
The weather returns to normal, but all the dragons are too big.
111112111212111221111111111212211.content:
You then see a gust of snow blow before you. After the gust passes you see an abominable snowman and by the looks of it you could tell that it was being animated by dark fairy magic, but was created using ice magic.

"RAWWWR!"

"So that's what the Lord's of the Night used to create the snow. Don't touch it or you'll freeze!" Loraine shouted.

After you defeat the abominable snowman the weather should return to normal, unfortunately the magic laced food may cause the dragons to be heavier than they would at this time of year, but you're certain that the dragon populace should be able to slow down their weight gain before winter so they won't be too fat. Then again they might just sell off their excess lard and just work off the rest of the hibernation weight since their metabolism Sikes upwards once it's spring and their annual growth spurt.

Then you have to rescue your father and stop Marlani. Then the Lord's of Darkness aka the Lord's of the Night have to be dealt with. You and your allies then use indirect attacks at the abominable snowman. The snowman charges at you. You quickly dodge the attack.

Loraine and Shalla combine their magic. You then notice the abominable snowman melt. After melting completely you pierce the monster's artificial heart. As soon you destroy the heart...
111112111212111221111111111212211.title: Abominable Snowman

choices: Undead orcs attacking villages and psychotic ramblings
Someone falling from the sky!
1111121112121112211111111112122111.content:
As soon as you destroy the heart the weather returns to normal. You are relieved that the dragons didn't too big, since it would be a huge problem if they couldn't get to their caves. Despite being larger than normal at least they are at a safe hibernation weight.

"Thank you Sir Lionshield and your Royal Highness. You and your companions saved us from being used as lard farms."

"Not a problem Gildorum. I'm sure you and your mate can still fly." Loraine said.

"I flown with this much weight before. Sure it takes longer, but the extra weight helps build stronger muscles. How else do we dragons become strong. Once I return with Shanara We'll probably burn some of the blubber we have through mating."

"Take care noble dragons. May you have a good hibernation." You said as you and your companions wave goodbye.

You then set your sights on Weslone to rescue your father and retrieve the cure for the queen, however you hear screaming in the distance. You stop in your tracks.

"What does Warrior of Lions hear?" Torque asked.

"Something sinister like..."
1111121112121112211111111112122111.title: Weather back to normal and Dragons saved

choices: The royal army arrives. Two royal guards you recognized are here to help.
Orc assassins, giants, a fairy resistance, and a magician and his friends appear
11111211121211122111111111121221111.content:
"Something sinister like undead orcs attacking villages and psychotic ramblings." You told Torque.

"Desecrating orc graves big crime in our culture."

"It sounds like that murderous psycho has her tiny bloodstained hands in this."

"Sakara is involved in this?" No wonder why."

You remember your first encounter with that fairy and your second encounter as well. The thought of someone deriving joy out of killing honestly creeper you out, but as a warrior you won't falter against that fairy like the other time. Despite Sakara's appearance and the tiara she wore she is still a black hearted villain who deserves to be vanquished.

"Let's go. Those people need our help."

Your comrades nod in agreement. You and your allies rush off In direction of the screaming. Once there you see an army of undead orcs and brainwashed fairies. They appear to be killing anyone in their path and consequently turning them into zombies via necromancy.

You spot Sakara accompanied by two other dark fairies. Unlike Sakara the dark fairies weren't bloodthirsty, but they were evil in other ways. One dark fairy was vainly looking at her reflection while casting spells and the other had an envious look in her eyes.

"Queen Sakara, it looks like some heroes are here to totally ruin our fun."

"Mrgrgr, it's no fair that they have to take away what's mine! What are your orders my queen."

"We kill them along with Mathis. He was caught stealing from our ally. We also must force these orc villages into submission. But that stupid orc shaman is ruining everything. I want her to die as well."

"When did Sakara become a queen?" You asked Shalla.

"Sorry, but I had no clue that my race had a ruler."

"It was a week after the queen was cursed. They say that Sakara murdered the former fairy queen after encountering giants in Magus Town." Gilda replied.

"So that explains the tiara. Let's evacuate these orc villagers. Torque and Shalla, can you rescue the villagers while the three of us take on Sakara and her minions."

"Torque and I won't let you down."

"Thanks Shalla."

Torque and Shalla start evacuating the villagers while you, Loraine and Gilda fight the army of undead and hypnotized fairies.

"Lion Warrior, we may not be able to hold them off. We spent most of energy fighting off the snowman monster."

"I know, but I have a feeling that reinforcements are on the way! Also Mathis is pitching in."

You notice a fear stricken Mathis fighting off the undead orcs.

"Just stay dead! I'm too handsome to die today!"

"Still as vile as ever no matter how charming he makes himself." Gilda said as she dodged an attack.

"Now my minions kill them all!"

Sakara then sings her wicked song. The spell on the hypnotized and undead grows stronger. They become more violent than before. Just as Sakara's army got a morale boost...
11111211121211122111111111121221111.title: Sakara and the Sinister Army

choices: Look into the Mirror of Fear. Your own reflection appears in the mirror.
You defeat the undead army, but one of your allies look into the mirror of fear
111112111212111221111111111212211111.content:
Just as Sakara's army got a morale boost you hear trumpets sound. It's the Royal Knights, an advanced unit of royal guards. They usually lead the Royal Elite Guards in times of war and they take orders directly from Princess Loraine since she is the Royal Knight Commander. The Royal Knights start charging at the undead orcs. They skillfully slew them with their enchanted weapons.

"What? No fair! More people have come to take all that is mine!" The envious dark fairy complained.

"Awesome! Now this should be fun! The chance to kill the princess an the royal army is too good to pass up."

"Sakara, I can't like afford to uh die. Maybe we should set a couple of traps that cause them to go totally crazy." The vain dark fairy said as she began applying black lipstick to her lips.

"There should be enough undead to kill them off and I can always reanimate them and enjoy killing them all over again. Since Cyrone's plan failed Marlani has to find another sleeping damsel."

"Then maybe the Witch of the Forest would be a perfect substitute. I totally have a spell that has the Sarona Death Plant, or better known as the Slumber Flower, as an ingredient." The vain dark fairy said as she began combing her hair.

"I guess retreating is good as long as I can loot their valuables." The envious dark fairy said.

Sakara and the dark fairies disappear. Little did you realize the other dark fairies used their dark magic to summon a small army of imps and a particular mirror. It wasn't until you saw Torque, Shalla, and an orc shamaness that you noticed the imps.

"Lion Warrior, is that you?" A familiar voice asked.

"You're one of the guards that I met in Marina. I see that you and Naphtali got promoted."

"We'll that'swhat happens when you faithfully follow the Commander's orders. As soon as we left while you were still competing Loraine gave us promotions. The only thing I didn't expect was to see you as a literal lion." Naphtali said as he slashed an undead orc.

"Trust me friend, I have no intention of remaining this way. Though there are advantages it will not bode well for people to see a famed hero in a cursed state like this." You said while swiftly swinging your warhammer.

As you continued fighting you...
111112111212111221111111111212211111.title: The Royal Knights

choices: You and your allies discuss how to proceed with the rescue of your father
After a night of sleep you and your allies resume your quest
1111121112121112211111111112122111111.content:
As you continued fighting you look into the mirror of fear.

Didn't Esmerlda say that she looked into that mirror one time when we were liberating a town from Constance. I remember her explaining it to me shortly after Constance was arrested. I believe her words were 'Don't look into the Mirror of Fear' If this is the real thing than it brings whatever I fear to...

You gulp as your reflection appears in the mirror. The man had the same red hair and amber colored eyes as you which meant that he would be your exact double. You prepare your weapons as your doppelganger steps out of the mirror. Your doppelganger then turns into a were lion like yourself.

"What's up with the two Lion Warriors?" Gilda asked.

"The other Reymond is a fake." A royal knight said.

"That's the Legendary Mirror of Fear! It turns anyone's fears into reality. Once freed the fear can only be destroyed by breaking the mirror."

You then see the Mirror of Fear float up in the air and catch the gazes of all who are present. Loraine gasped as her own reflection emerged from the mirror. Unlike the real Loraine the one the mirror produced was dressed as if she was a warlord. For the others present various creatures or people that they were terrified of.

You and your allies cringe as the Mirror of Fear flies away.

"So you're supposed to be me? If you were you would have saved your father from that witch. You are truly pathetic." Your evil doppelganger said in a scoffing tone.

You realized that your fear was failing those that you care about since the doppelganger acted as your complete opposite, but why did the mirror create a duplicate of Loraine instead of a creature or person for her fear unless she's worried about failing to save her mother from her cursed illness. You then notice that your duplicate is about to strike.

You block your doppleganger's strike. Your doppelganger grins evilly.

"Not bad Lion Warrior, but you bore me to tears. You're not worth killing today."

Your evil doppelganger takes off. Loraine's evil duplicate disappears and the other fears summoned by the Mirror of Fear disappear as well. You had a foreboding feeling that you and your comrades will have to face your fears once again.

Meanwhile in a town close to Weslone, Marlani was enjoying the turn of events in her crystal ball.

"Looks like Sakara's connections to the fairy kingdom has proven to work well as allies."

"Indeed they have milady. Soon the Demon within me shall be ready to be released. The dark fairy Vannah has made an excellent suggestion for a substitute. After being exposed to the Slumber Flower one builds a slight resistance if exposed again. Your twin would work well as a replacement."

"Indeed she will and I have the perfect plan to enact Vannah's idea But first I need to destroy the cure that I have in front of the Lion Warrior. It was kind for one of the Lord's of Darkness to volunteer with this ruse."

"You mean those guys who are trying to recruit us into their organization?" A woman with platinum hair asked.

"Exactly Madam Raven. Why don't you prepare for the guests you'll be getting. They should be here in two days."
1111121112121112211111111112122111111.title: Mirror of Fear: Your Darkest Fear Unleashed

choices: Back to your (POV)
See where Gilda's captors take her
111112111212111221111111112.content:
As Gilda was examining the town she had found some surprising details. The town was originally called Skaar, a town of orcish origins A judging by the huts and the makeshift weapons inside. Apparently Marlani was trying to force this tribe of orcs into submission judging by the recent evidence of bloodshed. Gilda immediately knew that she sent that dark fairy to lead a massacre, yet there was evidence of some of them escaping. Gilda then froze as she saw Loraine, your father and yourself unconscious and in a carriage.

"Damn it! I knew we couldn't trust that Cyrone!"

Gilda readied a dagger, but she was caught off guard by some rustling in the tree behind her. Gilda then saw a peculiar powder at the base of the tree. When she turned around she noticed that the carriage with you and the others had taken off.

"No! There's no way I can catch that snake now! This your fault you blasted fairy!" Gilda yelled as she threw her dagger at the tree.

The fairy then flew out of the tree. The fairy wore a purple and blue dress and had black hair and green eyes.

"You're not that murderous dark fairy! Who the hell are you! Tell me or I will end your miserable life!"

The fairy readied her magic. As Gilda was about to throw a second dagger an orc appeared from behind her and whacked her on the head.

"Curse you bloody orc!" Gilda said as she passed out.

The orc then throws Gilda over his shoulders and heads to the caves directly below Skarr with the fairy.
111112111212111221111111112.title: Switch to Gilda's POV(third person only)

choices: Gilda Convinces them
Gilda fails to Convince them
1111121112121112211111111122.content:
As Gilda slowly began to open up her eyes, she quickly managed to get a view of her surroundings. She was definitely in a cave. It looked as though the Orcs that were living here before have long since abandoned it. She looked around some more and that was when she saw him, the very orc that hit her over the head and took her here. What was surprising though was that he had a chance to kill you and didn't, but he had definitely went looking through Gilda's stuff. Gilda didn't exactly like that thought. Next to the orc sitting upon his shoulder was a fairy. Gilda was certain it was the same one that she tried to attack earlier.

" Look she's awake." The Fairy said. The orc then came towards Gilda and she tried to ready herself to fight him, only to find that they still had her weapons with them! "Great, now I'm at the mercy of some random Orc and a fairy an unusual pair. Guess I'm lucky they haven't tried to kill me yet." Gilda thought.

" Where fathers' soul human?" The Orc asked. The question was a bit confusing to Gilda at first but thankfully the fairy cleared the message up a bit for her.

" Humans stole the sword of my friend which contains his fathers' soul. The went up and took it from his grave, then we heard of a human who takes things and figured that must be the person who took the sword." The fairy said...

Gilda now knew what these two were looking for. Of course the fact that an Orc and a Fairy called each other friend was most unusual, especially since it is widely known that most Orcs enslave fairies. How there friendship began is a curious matter, but not important right now. Luckily being a thief also means having a good tongue to get you out of dangerous situations. You then realize the tower that you and your mentor were exploring was near a mountain.

"Good morning, you were passed out when you were brought to the lodge. I heard that you were attacked by a succubus when you were exploring the tower. How did that happen?"

"It was the creation of an evil mirror. "

"You are talking about the Mirror of Fear. They say that the Mirror of Fear was by a sisterhood of witches and a brotherhood of warlocks. Infact the Dark Circle as they were called created several more like it upon other dangerous artifacts. "

" That should be correct. In the past the Church worked with the Seven Star Guild. Unfortunately after the Demon was defeated the Church quickly became corrupt. To make matters worse the Queen wanted the Church destroyed. The Church was wiped out along with the Seven Star Guild, but from the Church's demise came the Orders of the Living One. Each of the Orders were composed of clergymen and mage from the guild. By forming these orders we were able to preserve ancient spells both arcane and divine."

"So you used an ancient blessing to revive me, right?"

"That's because he's afraid that people would think that he's insane. On a semi related note, are you afraid of women or just succubi?"

" Both unfortunately. I was abused by my mother when I was a child. Every night she would return home drunk and harm me with her weapons. One night my parents killed each other. My father was protecting me from drunken mother. In the end they both pierced each other through the stomach. That night I became an orphan. The following day as I set off to find some sort of work I was mugged by a group of homeless girls. They took everything I had and left me naked. "

" That's horrible! How did you survive? "

" I was taken in by a charasmatic man. He was good looking and popular with the ladies. He also had a daughter, but I can't recall her name. It was that instance that I met Marvin. For starters I was terrified of her. Despite her kindness and popularity among boys she scared the living daylights out of me when she practiced magic. I was afraid that she would say an incantation incorrectly or cast a curse on me for revenge. "

"You must mean the Witch of the Forest. She's popular with men, but she keeps getting thrown in jail by jealous women. Hopefully she can find a guy that understands her without acting like a perv. The last rumor I heard was that she was almost tortured by men who wanted to fulfill their perverted desires. "

It was at that time that the men of the town burned Marvin's son alive. Soon afterward the men who murdered Marvin's son started hitting on his granddaughter and the women were trying to do unto her what the men did to her father. "

"That is strange. Normally natural carisma shouldn't cause that. Sounds like a family curse. "

As you head towards the door the proprietress blocks the door.

"Where do you think you're going darling?" The proprietress said in a lustful manner.

"Silly boy, don't you know anything thing about sex fiends? Once we take even a fraction of our victim's life force we can't easily be destroyed. How else do you think your mentor got sick the first time after your little adventure in the tower?"

"That was you who nearly killed him the first time?"

"That's right, but now I'll have to punish you since you know too much."

The succubus pulls out a whip and tries to hit you with it. Fortunately you dodged the attack. Despite being a nightmare the scenario felt all too real. You then teleport outside of the tavern. "I am the vessel that contains the great demon. Once the demon within me is freed he shall take on a new body. Will you be the one to free the demon within me?"

You instantly remember something that you heard your mentor say from your first expedition of the first tower. The vessel that contains the demon must have been cursed with a body of a human! Before you can react the man uses his dark magic to create a hole beneath your feet. As you fall you see the succubus and an incubus grinning evilly at you as you fall down the hole.

You wake up and notice that giants from Gimunga have descended. You quickly ask run outside and see seven giants. You then ask another mage what's going on.

"Pardon me, but what is it with these giants?"

"It's called they came from above. We can't be too sure if they come in peace or not. We've had trouble with brigands from both orcs and giants. We can't afford to take any chances."

"If they were here to attack wouldn't they be charging at us and completely destroy the village? Sometimes I think people just make quick assumptions." Gracia said.

You then notice a giantess stand up and raise her hand to show that she is unarmed.

"Humans please stop! We come in peace! We are here to negotiate mutually beneficial trading arrangements, not to attack you." The giantess said.

However, the mage you were talking to wasn't convinced by the giantess's words.

"This is probably some trick. Everything she says is a lie!"

The mage then fires at magical bolt at the giantess. Luckily the giantess narrowly dodges the magical bolt.

"Dammit!"

"Are you trying to start a war? For a magician you're awfully hotheaded."

"Shut up priestess! I don't need your preaching!"

You notice that the priestess was about to speak again.

"Look at our clothes! If we were brigands, would we be dressed in such finery? Would we not charge with our weapons in hand?"

After seeing the giantess's reaction and the way she spoke, you're hoping that no one is hotheaded enough to provoke the giants into attacking.

" I am the village leader here and I have to ask of you why have you descended upon us?" She asked.

However he respected the wishes of the leader and didn't try to do anything else. It was then that one of the giants had spoke.

The rest of the talks as you could see went rather well, the only thing noteworthy of happening was that a dragon attacked but fortunately it was defeated far too easily. In fact something the dragon said was indeed curious but after that you learned that these giants were no ordinary giants.

Crystals as beautiful as these should sell for a good price.

There must be a dragon inside. Judging by the way these rocks are worn this dragon had to widen the passageways during winter to make room when he was at his hibernation weight.

His white and gold scales shone brightly and his impressive height and musculature were a testament to his power. You scan the area and see an ornate box. I wonder what could be inside? I must take it.

You tiptoe towards the box that was next to the dragon. Unfortunately your cloak gets snagged on a stalagmite and a piece of it tears off. 1413.content:
You decide to wait it out. There's no point in rushing in blindly. For all you know the intruders may have some powerful magic. Unlike other orcs you were from one of the three mysterious tribes. No one in orc society knows the name of your tribe or the other two besides your tribe, the Legendary Orc King, and the other two tribes. The name of your tribe is known as the Adventure Breaker Tribe. Unlike the other tribes your tribe is usually sent out by the Legendary Orc King to learn more about the other races. The other two tribes are the Assassin Breaker Tribe, which is the Legendary Orc King's secret task force that covertly spies on any invaders or war parties from the shadows, and the War Breaker Tribe, a tribe dedicated to declaring war on those who invade your home. You and some of your tribesmen returned from an adventure.

Your Warchief had put you on guard duty. All of your tribesmen go through a rotation where if an orc goes on an adventure they are put on guard duty for a while. It was no surprise that every able orc has went on at least one adventure. It was uncommon for female orcs to go on adventures as long as they prove themselves before the Chief that is. As you quietly wait you have a sense of dread. From around the corner you here maniacal laughter. The voice to who the laughter belonged to was definitely high-pitched.

"This is so much fun! I just love spilling blood. It makes me feel so alive!" The high-pitched voice echoed through the cave.

"Sakara, remember we are only creating a diversion. The thief that Lady Marlani hired should be have a clear path to the sword that she desires."

"I know Leron. Just turn into a werelion and help me kill these orcs. I don't want you to spoil my fun! If you do so I'll make you into my personal sparing partner."

"Whatever Sakara. You know your bloodlust will eventually cost you your own life."

From the conversation you can tell that these two intruders have a thief among their ranks and they plan on stealing a sword. You remember that the warchief from the Defense Breaker tribe died gloriously in battle. His son Torque would naturally be a consideration as the next warchief, not because of blood, but due to his spirit. However, he befriended a fairy slave, a water fairy named Shalla. You weren't against the idea since you seen fairies work alongside humans from time to time, but unfortunately against you and some of your tribe members.

You quickly take cover behind a boulder as you hear some footsteps. You glance from the boulder as you see a lion man and what appears to be a dark fairy. You are tempted to strike, but you watch from the boulder as some members from the other tribes rush the attackers.

I have to see if I can pinpoint there weaknesses. Rushing in without knowing what the enemy can do would only result in pointless deaths. By knowing the enemy I can know how to beat them. Even the Legendary Orc King himself would advise such an approach. He did hail from our tribe after all.

As your fellow orcs charge at the lion man and dark fairy you observe that the lion man is extremely fast and strong and that the dark fairy uses here magic to instantly kill all who oppose her.

"That was fun! Let's kill some more!"

You couldn't believe your eyes. These two individuals killed that many orcs. Your fellow orcs did kill a few humans, but those two would definitely outclass you. The only tribe that could take these intruders were the Fear-Giver Tribe or the Assassin Breaker Tribe since they had superior stealth despite their burly builds. You then notice the lion man sniffing the air.

"Looks like there's at least an orc here. He's alive as well."

"Awesome! That means I can kill him! Let me kill him!"

"No Sakara, let him live. He may fetch some reinforcements. "

"What a smart idea. It would get boring if I killed him and no one else was around. I could always entertain myself by breaking his bones and cutting his body. Maiming and slow painful deaths also gives me satisfaction."

It looks like they know I'm here. I need to warn the chief and the Legendary Orc King. I don't mind dying in battle, but there is no honor in dying for the sake of revenge. I may not know why humans invade our home, but I'm beginning to understand why. They really view our race creatures to be killed and looted. Even while adventuring I never known why humans look at us with disgust, but seeing a fairy who kills for her own amusement makes it pretty clear. There should be a secret passage by this boulder that the Assassin Breaker Tribe uses. If I can reach the chief and the Legendary Orc King we can formulate a plan to stop those murderers.

You feel around the wall and try to find the passage. After tapping the wall a few times you realize that the boulder that your hiding behind might be covering the passage. You push the boulder out of the way. You see a hole and a rope tied to a giant metal spike. The fairy and lion man had already left. You then climb down the hole. Once in the secret passageway...

Once in the secret passageway you manage to hear your hief and the Legendary Orc King Sharmiron talking about what to do. By following their voices you make your way into the Legendary Orc King's throne room. Upon entering you are quickly noticed by orcs of of the Assassin Breaker Tribe.

Sharmiron was a tall orc with blue skin and impressive muscles. He wore Wolfson armor laced with bronze and steel. Though kind in mannerisms it is unwise to provoke him to anger. Doing so does not end well and usually results in a harsh and justified punishment.

"How did you find one of the entrances to our secret passageway and why are you not at your post?"

"I come with dire news from the front lines."

"Speak on of what happened." Sharmiron said with concern.

"Thank you great Legendary Orc King. I was at my post when two terribly strong intruders came in. They were a dark fairy and a lion man. They mentioned something about a thief being hired to steal the former chief of the Defense Breaker Tribe's soul."

"That is most worry some. The thief probably already made their clean getaway by now. I'll have to send Torque to recover his father's sword. Having ones own tribe's former chief's sword stolen while on duty greatly tarnished the tribe's honor. Since Torque was the Warchief's son it will be his responsibility. Earth forbid what those miscreants will do with the word."

"Thank you for the report. Standby until we can organize a militia with the other two secret tribes." Your Warchief's said.

"Hold on Warchief Axel. I think I may require a new advisor. The tournament is about to begin and you and I know that all Warchiefs and the title for king are up for grabs. All we can do is send Torque and his fairy friend out on an important quest and pick a new advisor that serve me or the next orc king."

"I agree with you my liege. I have already been doing some studying on who would replace the Councilor Bane. My orcs have noticed an exceptional shamaness who is more than qualified for the job." The Assassin Breaker Tribe Warchief said.

"Excellent work Warchief Shadomire. Fetch the shamaness during the tournament. That way we can bring her up to speed. Also bring me Torque so I may send him out to retrieve his father's soul."

"I will not let you down my liege."

Warchief Shadomire and the Assassin Breaker Tribe disappear in the blink of an eye. You patiently stand at attention until addressed.

"You there from the Adventure Breaker Tribe. You showed wisdom and courage by coming here with this news. If I to pass my torch to another you would be my first pick. Please help the other tribe's rebuild and repair the settlements. After that prepare for the tournament. There you'll be tested on wheaten you are ready for greater responsibility."

You bow before the Legendary Orc King and salute with your sword. You then sheath your sword and head out to help your fellow orcs rebuild.

You turn around and see the most menacing orc that you laid your eyes on. She had black hair and purple skin. Many skull earrings hung from her ears. Her scarlet eyes made all who looked into them tremble. Despite having a good looking and beautiful appearance when it came to her face she wore the creepiest battle armor in history.

The armor was made from the hide of dragons and decorated with teeth from various species that she had slain. The orc was the leader of the Fear-Givers, Warchieftess Scarletta.

"How thoughtful deary. You know you may be speaking to the next queen of the orcs. I plan on smiting the Legendary Orc King in the tournament. Farewell deary and don't die of fright."

The Warchieftess cackles in a disturbing manner. You can't help but feel your teeth chatter momentarily. The last thing you wanted was for the orc king to die. He was part of your tribe and intend on letting him regardless of becoming the new orc king or not.

You were even attracted to his eldest daughter. Surely after the tournament if you win or lose you could at least become part of his family. Yet in order for that to happen you would have to defeat his daughter in combat.
